92797ef488b7b1fff4342c6ba6b02c69 (18:51): I'm reading about the new TCP/IP stack that SUN has implemented. Does the thread for the specific connection starve if the CPU, used for that thread, is assigned to a zone that has 100% workload?
92797ef488b7b1fff4342c6ba6b02c69 (18:51): as they assign a thread to a particular CPU and it dont change

3eeb5a9a2fdb67cc1b5941d2990b91b7 (19:15): hi all, quick question, why would sol10 (and sol9 for that matter) always look up the DNS entry for a host even if there is an entry in /etc/hosts ?
3eeb5a9a2fdb67cc1b5941d2990b91b7 (19:16): telnet: Unable to connect to remote host: Connection refused
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (19:16): bonobo_slr, check your  nsswitch.conf file in  /etc   if it has a  line like  hosts:dns  files  then it will ask dns first
e55e49dbdc0b3b324ddec7711f265523 (19:16): because the nsswitch.conf have 'hosts: dns hosts' rather than 'hosts: hosts dns' ?
3eeb5a9a2fdb67cc1b5941d2990b91b7 (19:19): i even ran svcadm restart svc:/network/dns/client
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (19:22): bonobo_slr, what happens if you use  puck.telkomsa.net
3eeb5a9a2fdb67cc1b5941d2990b91b7 (19:23): it resolves to the external IP which is the entry in DNS, i want it to connect to the internal interface
3eeb5a9a2fdb67cc1b5941d2990b91b7 (19:23): which is why I put the entry in the host file.
3eeb5a9a2fdb67cc1b5941d2990b91b7 (19:24): i suppose I could just create another dns entry, but this should have worked..
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (19:25): try moving the puck line to the frist line in the hosts file

130a5b7f2199284cd58153f0172a505a (19:39): Any cluster people out there - can you answer this - I'm building a grid of diskless servers - I don't want the failure of the NFS host to cause a grid failure - if I use HA-NFS - do you know if the host (that depends on that mount point for all its files) will fail? I will be trying this next week - but if someone knows it gives me a starting point
aa939d032327c8399cf2851d5b0201ed (19:41): that's not a cluster question - it's a diskless client question
130a5b7f2199284cd58153f0172a505a (19:46): well its a ha-nfs question - will a client that is served via ha-nfs notice the loss of the mount point
aa939d032327c8399cf2851d5b0201ed (19:49): it's NFS - it'll just keep retrying
